Crimes.Crime_Name: Potential Immigration Offences (if any misrepresentation occurred in the process of entering Canada)
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicants are Convention refugees or persons in need of protection due to lack of state protection
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicants failed to follow up on police complaints
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Police complaints, evidence of partial state intervention
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Domestic violence and fear of persecution in Mexico
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to exhaust local remedies and rebut presumption of state protection
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Refugee protection claim and subsequent judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Insufficient evidence to establish inadequate state protection
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: No indication of ignored evidence; rather, insufficient evidence provided
Crimes.Application_Factor: Availability of state protection in home country
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness of panel's conclusion on state protection
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Inability to rebut presumption of state protection
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of follow-up on complaints, incomplete use of local resources
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process found to be procedurally fair
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Partial credibility due to lack of engagement with authorities
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim that state protection was ineffective
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Standard of review in judicial review of administrative decisions
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to pursue available legal remedies in home country
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Not applicable — claim was about protection, not inadmissibility

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee protection based on gender-based violence
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Insufficient to prove lack of state protection
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Partially credible but undermined by lack of follow-up
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Concerns due to failure to pursue local remedies
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Standard of review in administrative appeals
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Administrative hearing followed by judicial review

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to Provide Support (if applicable under context not fully provided)
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether state protection in Mexico was adequate
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Evidence showed some state intervention and services
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On claimants to show inadequate state protection
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Failure to follow up on complaints reduces credibility
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Presumption of state protection unless clearly rebutted
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Sufficiency of evidence in refugee hearings
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of domestic violence and lack of protection
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Police complaints, availability of shelters and legal aid
Crimes.Defendant_Response: State has mechanisms even if imperfect
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Not inadmissible; claim based on protection needs

Crimes.Violation_Type: Failure to demonstrate eligibility for protection
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether applicants proved inadequate state protection
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants fled threats from ex-husband in Mexico
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Recognition as Convention refugee or person in need of protection
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Domestic violence and threats in Mexico
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Partially credible but insufficient to meet burden
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Testimony, police records, evidence of limited state action
Crimes.Application_Basis: Fear of return due to past abuse
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Existence of initial police response and available services
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of proof that state protection is wholly ineffective
Crimes.Cause_Description: Alleged threats from ex-husband and inadequate state response
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: None directly violated; issue of eligibility under IRPA
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Extraterritorial application of Canadian protection law
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Some state action noted, claimants did not pursue remedies
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Presumption of state protection not rebutted
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to provide conclusive evidence of systemic failure
